intro: Leucopogon wheelerae, commonly known as the Wheelerae heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in heathlands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Leucopogon wheelerae is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained environments.
